The locals are often hostile to the visitors
Home sweet home
Prosperous village
Distant village, rarely visited by foreigners
Road to Vaterland
Road to Vahat
Road to Ridzin
Road to Krai
Road to Vaterland
Road to Vaterland
Road to Sacred Grove
Road to Argen
Road to Argen
Road to Vaterland
Road to Sacred Grove
Road to Librium
Path to Librium
Road to Librium
Road to Ignott
Road to Sacred Grove
Road to Krai
Road to Argen
Road to Zarmek
Border town, surrounded by fields
Scientific centre of the new world
The only known port town
Farmer village
Farmer village
Farmer village
Farmer village
Village by the Colosseum
Bridge town at the crossroads of the major trade roads is the only place in the world where the trucks must pay a fare. Many factions plan to conquer it, but so far no one succeed.
At first glance it is just a village lost in the middle of nowhere but it is actually the center of clandestine trade with the Occident.
It is a bastion of free trade and a model of honest trade achievements.
The miners dig deep to find a slightest piece of precious materials or artifacts.
In spite of favorable location, this village is very poor. Probably because it cannot compete with the large factions. Or its people are just lazy.
A tiny village where nothing ever happens.
The source of oil of the NPT.
Tons of ancient weapons are buried in the basement of this ancient military base.
Road to Krai
Road to Librium
Road to Ridzin
Road to Hel
This trade town is the North Path Traders’ important source of wealth. It provides them with rare merchandise and never-ending struggles with the locals.
Village of fishers
Small village
The capital of Commonwealth of Independent Towns. Within its walls strategic plans of battle against Crimson Dawn are born.
This town provides the main industrial support to the CIT army.
CIT’s Military base, where hundreds of soldiers await orders to defend the native land.
Distant village
This settlement is often being attacked by CD’s mercenaries.
People of this village are ready to give all they have to support the soldiers in the battle against the CD.
Logistics is an important part of the warfare, that’s why the locals work hard to help the army.
Headquarters of the Church of Enlightenment. Few uninitiated actually visited it and returned.
Scared people work here round the clock to provide supplies to the Axel’s mercenaries.
Axel’s hidden town. Only a couple of most trusted men know its whereabouts. It is the heart of the Crimson Down.
Unassailable fortress that coordinates the actions of a big gang of cutthroats that the people of Argen became.
Boundary settlement. However nobody remembers what border it is about.
Farmer settlement.
The people of this village are often attacked by both sides.
To Vahat
Grand town of the Druids raise its towers to the skies like the branches of a hundred-year-old oak.
Small settlement in the middle of the forest. A nice place to hide from the storms of the outer world.
Children of Iron, former druids, rebuilt their town according to the new beliefs.
Village of ex-brigands
Road to Hel
Oracle’s Disciples holds here their rites in hope to attract his attention.
Once prosperous town has been reduced almost to rubble in the last few years. It preserved traces or the former greatness, though.
The capital of Vahat is the true jewel of the Oasia. Since older days this town is well known for its unsurpassed gunsmiths and architects.
Townspeople organize spectacular races for everyone willing to participate. Not that there are too many people, however.
Small town on the edge of the desert has witnessed a lot of strange and terrible events.
Ancient port at the shore of the dead sea. Dozens of ships that will never see the ocean again rot here.
Richest oilfield in the world.
Settlement, suffering from constant raider’s attacks.
Scientific settlement founded at near the source of alien radiation.
Whole Oasia dreads this place, where hundreds of madmen gather to start the next attack.
Gas station
Large trade town. It is a source of rare merchandise and never-ending struggle with the locals.
Village of fishers.
Small village.
Settlement by the ruins
You can live even by the swamp.
Distant miner village.
Friends of traders live here.
This distant druids’ village serves as a refuge to the people who are tired from the war.
Old military base, inhabited by the aggressive madmen. There are few people who passed through it alive.
For some reason this sage druid left his brother and live here alone.
Though this vehicle doesn’t look impressive, its stats are quite impressive.
A race car made of junk.
